column3: Just for reference, [here's the original PR for the mac_alias patch](https://github.com/al45tair/mac_alias/pull/3).

Added a commit upgrading mac_alias to 2.0.7 and did `make deploy` on my Macbook Pro. The resultant DMG file allowed me to place Core in /Applications. Core runs fine. Background image of the DMG looks fine. A couple of the icons are in weird spots but this is apparently normal. Besides, as mentioned, the core functionality is present.
Looks good to me, @theuni might want to sign off on this because it's a depends change.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12417/commits/fc1bfcf9fd2c24846a9f9caa42f5370f192c3d40\n\n@droark Could you post a screenshot of the out of place icons for reference?
@droark You just have hidden files showing. That's normal.

@theuni - Oh no, I understand the hidden folders. :) I just seemed to recall some issue/PR from awhile back where something similar was discussed, and how the macOS builds put the icons in odd places. I thought it had been resolved? I can't remember where I saw all this, though, and I could be wrong. Better safe than sorry!\n\n**EDIT**: Again, just to be clear, I was able to install the build wi
@droark what version of macOS are you using?
